H0.text: Direction is the component that a vector, often represented by an arrow, has along with size.

H1.text: Pressure is a measurement that, along with size, defines a vector that is often represented by an arrow.

H2.text: Location is what a vector, often represented by an arrow, has in addition to size.

H3.text: Reason is the characteristic that a vector, often represented by an arrow, has along with its size.

A4.text: Historically, vectors were introduced in geometry and physics (typically in mechanics) for quantities that have both a magnitude and a direction, such as displacements, forces and velocity.
